question: Which passed away first â€” the South African-born Australian author known for sweeping historical fiction, or the Uruguayan novelist associated with existentialist themes in Latin American literature?
llm_answer: Bryce Courtenay, the South African-born Australian author, passed away on November 22, 2012, at the age of 79. Juan Carlos Onetti, the Uruguayan novelist, passed away on May 30, 1994, at the age of 85. Therefore, Juan Carlos Onetti passed away first.
